page.title: 15HIGH HURSTWOOD SERVICES
page.content: A recent improvement in public services has been the provision of a weekly refuse collection with specially designed plastic dustbins on wheels allotted to every household and a speedy mechanised system of emptying them into lorries. Away from the main roads there is no main drainage and all houses have a cesspool or septic tank. Piped gas is not available. All houses have electricity but power failures are a hazard everyone has to be prepared for especially in thunder- storms. Farms have petrol generators and most homes keep alternative methods of heating and lighting. Side roads can become treacherous in icy weather and are the last to be attended to. Local farmers are often called on by the Council to help with gritting and snow clearance.
